name: Vættir
description: The Vættir is a Medium-sized undead with a solid chain shirt armor. It possesses striking characteristics, embodying an eerie presence that combines both deceptive nature and physical strength.
memorable: Its ability to rejuvenate within 24 hours unless put to rest makes it a relentless foe in combat.
goals: To track down and reclaim its grave goods while tormenting and incapacitating its enemies.
relations: Often encountered with other undead creatures or as a guardian of graves.
environment: Commonly found in burial grounds or abandoned places associated with death.
strengths: High Strength score provides exceptional melee attacks, and resilience against many conditions due to undead nature.
weaknesses: Vættir suffers disadvantages on attack and perception rolls while exposed to sunlight, making it vulnerable to daylight tactics.
attacks: Utilizes a combination of a powerful greataxe attack and necrotic bolts for ranged combat.
most_powerful_ability: The Disorienting Gaze incapacitating foes for up to one minute can effectively disrupt enemy plans.
senses: The Vættir possesses truesight within 30 feet, allowing it to see through illusions and invisibility.
skills: Adept at evading attacks with high Dexterity saving throws.
additional_information: Immune to necrotic and poison damage due to its undead nature.
Has a unique Grave Goods Sense to track personal items.
Capable of unleashing a lethal Corpse Breath attack causing poison damage.
Reforms a new body in proximity to its destruction site within 24 hours.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep, making it tireless.
test_queries: undead creature with truesight and necrotic bolts
medium undead that can incapacitate using gaze
necrotic melee attack undead that can track belongings
